newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish firms lose PLN 5 bln of property in flood.
newsitem.headline: Polish firms lose PLN 5 bln of property in flood.

text.p: Polish firms suffered property losses estimated at about five billion zlotys as a result of devastating floods in the south of the country, a deputy economy minister said on Tuesday.
Jan Chaladaj told Reuters a total of eight billion zlotys of property was threatened by water damage.

"The estimate of property threatened by total or partial damage may be around eight billion zlotys in the macro scale, including about five billion in company property losses," said Chaladaj, who also heads the ministry's flood relief effort.
"But these figures may change significantly and should only be taken as indicative," he added. He said that updated figures may be available before the end of the week.
He said the eight billion zloty loss figure did not include destroyed bridges, roads and other infrastructure nor agriculture production losses.
